title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
[B][FONT=arial]Hope you can help. I have a 2015 MacBook air with the 820-00165-A board. The issue I'm having is the battery will not charge. Computer runs fine on wall adapter and the computer sees the battery. I tried another battery with the same result. I'm a bit new at this but catch on fast. I already have the board view for this board and have started troubleshooting.[/FONT][/B]

[B]PPBUS_G3H is 8.4v so I assume Q7155 is the issue. Is there a way for me to test Q7155? Anything else I should be checking?

Additionally I am using coconutBattery to see the Charging info. When I first attach the charger it shows charging at 10 watts then gradually drops to 0 watts.

Any help would be great.

Thanks[/B]

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Also on board diagnostic shows no issues.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Any history available?
Post voltage for U7100, pins 9, 15, 26.
Measure onboard exact value (ohm scale) for R7180/81 and R7185/86.
Do you get amber light when charger is connected?
Do you have original Apple 60/85W charger, MagSafe 2 model?

OSX shows some message like Replace/Service now for battery?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL6259 as well?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
As far as history goes not much other than being informed of the charging issue. Board looks clean. Water indicators all white.

On U7100 it appears there may be some corrosion between pins 8 and 9. Anyways here are the read outs. 

U7100
Pin 9 - .03v
Pin 15 - 8.56v
Pin 26 - 14.59v

7180 - 100.3k
7181 - 62.2k

7185 - .466
7186 - .331

Amber light shows on charger even with battery unplugged

45 mag safe 2 oem charger being used

No messages. Battery shows good.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
"Amber light shows on charger even with battery unplugged"
Normal behaviour. MagSafe light will switch back to green only if battery is 100% charged.

Try another charger, 60/85W if possible.

"Pin 26 - 14.59v"
Should be 0V in normal mode.

"Pin 15 - 8.56v"
Really???
Check again that...

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Well I guess I am going to try reflowing the chip. After cleaning it good with alcohol I am now successfully charging the battery BUT only charging at 1.84 watts. I assume there is additional corrosion that I cannot see.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Give time to fully charge it and take a look to the time reported.
Post again pin 9 & 15 voltage.

Please, do NOT quote an entire post from few cm above; is not aesthetic...

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Update.

It took approximately 36 hours to charge from 15% to 100%

Pin 9       .10v
Pin 15     .06v

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Chane C7125 and check its traces.
Post voltage for pin 1/Q7155.
Also check R7113 and its traces/solders.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
I double checked. This thing seems to act differently Everytime power is applied as far as u7100 goes

Pin 9 -   3.4v
Pin 15 - .07v


C7125 looks good

Q7155 pin 1 is 1.58v

R7113 looks good

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Change c7125?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Noob moment. Should I have the battery attached to the board for these tests?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Yes, both charger and battery connected.

"Pin 9 - 3.4v"
Are you really sure?
That is overcurrent on charger side.
Double check R7121/22 and theyr traces to R7120 and U7100.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
With battery connected

Q7155 pin 1  7.9v


U7100
Pin 9   2.15v
Pin 15  .23v

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
"With battery connected"
Should I suppose charger is connected too?

"Pin 9 2.15v"
Still too high.
As per schematic, 1.4V means more than 8A; imagine 2V how much is...
So
"Double check R7121/22..."

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Yes that was with charger and battery connected

Check this out. Right below pin 9. 

Trace contacts look rough. Anything I can do to clean this up?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Here is R7121/22

Any resistance values I should be checking for?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Pin 9 looks good, as R7121/22 too.
But components and traces for pins 7/8 are pretty ugly.
Clean that area and check/replace R7115/16 and C7115/16.
Aso take a look to R/C7142.
All these are involved in charging process.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Pretty sure I found issue. The Trace between r7115/16 to c7116 is not making a connection. Should I try laying in a wire jumper?

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message:
Follow schematic and rebuild the traces correctly.
Test points get corroded usually.
Be sure to have good solders on the components pins.

title: 820-00165 Charging Issue
message: Forgot to update this. Came down to rebuilding some traces. Thanks again everyone
